reviewText: this is probaly one of the best sagas in the the series. Goku and Gohan finaly come out of the Hyperbolic Time chamber where they have been training. Not only that but Gohan is now a Super Saiyah-jin. they learn of what has been going while they have been gone including the tournament that cell has planned. this is probly the best saga because its the only saga where you see young gohan as a Super Saiyan. you will diffinaly want to add this one to your collection.

reviewText: I agree with the first reviewer. It does lack of fighting, but it does have a certain interest leading up to the middle of the saga. What they've should've done is wish android 16 to be human instead of fixing him up. If that would've happened, then they could've used to namekian dragonballs for the wishes. by the way, why did FUNimation stop here with the DVD saga? I want to see the rest of the Cell Games saga!!!!

reviewText: .... overall, sure this video wasn't the best, but u can't expect fighting ALL the time, or the show wouldn't have a plot. this video gives u info, and a thing to look forward to. so get it.

reviewText: This tape starts the filler episodes in which the Z fighters have ten days to prepare for the Cell Games.Content: C+Animation: B+Music: B (dub)English Version: BFight Scenes: CWell, I can't really say this is a highlight of DBZ. Probably the only good points are when Cell makes his declaration of the Tournament. We also get to see the first appearence of Mister Satan (a.k.a. Hercule). In this volume, Goku finally meets the completed Cell and Gohan meets a girl named Lime. There is also the return of Goku's old nemesis General Tao. These episodes are basically character development episodes. But if you want to watch a show about martial arts and action, what the point of these episodes? Did the writers get tired? Anyway, I would recommend buying this tape, but than wait for the Cell games to actually start for the next volume.
summary: The start of another filler portion
Title: N/A
